review: Beer pretzels and cheese Zomg. Just wanna swim around in it. Warm soft chewy breadsticks. That app is to die for!! If you like cheese sauce, and come on, who doesn't?!??! I usually am very boring and predictable but I got the tomato soup, ham cheese grilled trio thingy. Its more a lunch item but you can get it whenever. Its a grilled ham and cheese sandwich, its more grown up with white cheese, a semi-zesty sauce and a darker rye/grainy bread. A small bowl of soup, and it comes with fries, but they will sub veggies or a salad. I'm pretending to be on a diet so I get the salad. My man gets the sizzling chicken and cheese. WHATS with all the cheese I know I know, but remember again, who doesn't like cheese. It has a mexican flair with all these onions and peppers almost like fajita chicken but not quite. Its so good and the name says it all. Sizzling, gooey melty cheese that sticks to everything as it cools. It comes with garlic mashed potatoes.  I don't usually get dessert here. They seem to rotate their dessert menu all the time and I don't really like their basic options and everything they get something good its a limited time thing. And besides, I'm on a diet, wink wink.  They service is a bit here or there, and its so dependent on when you go, who gets you etc. They are also open super late like 12-1 am something crazy like that. We usually get average to good service.

Only come here for the Mojitos... mango mojitos... to be exact and if your lucky, Jamie will be the one who makes them  for you.  I've ordered mojitos from just about every place that provides them... and TGIF .. does them proper.

I haven't been to a T.G.I.Friday's since my 5 1/2 year old twin girls were in diapers and eating pureed foods.  We were in Aurora to pick up some stuff for my partner's computer business and everyone was hungry, so we stopped off here.  It was just after 7pm and we waited about 20 minutes to be seated.  We had our twin girls with us that evening and the place was LOUD! Our server was friendly, the drinks were constantly filled and the food made it's way out in fairly decent time, especially given how busy they were.  They have certainly changed up their menu and presentation of the food since my last visit to one of their restaurants...and personally, I think it's for the better!  I had the black angus sirloin (6 ounce pre-cooked) with sweet potato fries and grilled mixed veggies, which was part of the "three for $16.99" promotion they have going on right now.  I shared my mozzarella sticks (appetizer) and my Oreo ice cream sandwich dessert with my daughters...I also shared my veggies and fries with them, but ate the steak on my own.  I asked for well done and it was well done but still VERY tender and moist with wonderful flavor!  My kids both had the chicken skewers (taken off the skewer for the half-pints) with pita bread and mashed potatoes and they both inhaled it.  My partner had some kind of Argentina inspired pesto with steak and although she said her food 'wasn't that great'....she certainly did down the whole thing! The only real complaint that I have is the table next to us with the obnoxious children (who looked to be around the same age as our twins...one about 5 and the other about 4 or so).  The kids were running up and down the aisle, screaming, getting in the way of the servers (the aisle was already narrow), bothering other patrons and...well...just being BRATS!   Yes, I can make comments about this type of behavior because not only do I have kids that age, but my kids KNOW better than to behave like that in a restaurant!  They know it's inappropriate and would get them into a lot of trouble.  My older two, who are now grown (newly grown, BTW) also knew better than to show out in a restaurant like that -- even with ADHD and even when the meds were low and/or they were tired.   It's a bad thing when your five year old kids look at the kids running around like screaming banshees, look at you and say, "why are they being bad, Mommy?"  Good question...

Service- Friendly and Fast Happy Hour- prices are great!  People Watching- (not sure if it's just the locaton) but this was the highlight! hahaha. Plenty of TV's to watch the games All in all just an A-OK time in good ol'Atown.

Yikes!!!! Never have I been sooooo disappointed in the Pot Stickers!!! Some were burnt to a crisp, others were soggy and half had chicken hanging out of them. The waitress didn't even acknowledge that it was an issue. #Fail
"Food is fine. When it finally got here. This is twice in a row that I've visited this TGIF with some of the worst service I've had. Won't be back. I'll go to another location."

I mean, it was a regular American restaurant as far as cleanliness and atmosphere... only thing was the floor was sticky under our table, but it was dry enough. Bathrooms were clean... The reason why I'm giving this a bad review is because our waitress had an attitude the whole night except for when we were leaving...and I had a horrible horrible stomach ache that night after eating there.  Never going back to another TGI Friday's

So i took my wife here for a date, BAD IDEA! So lets start out with going in. First off we asked for a booth but were given one next to the bar were the music volume is several decibels over normal conversation volume making it impossible to talk. So i asked for us to be moved to a quieter area and were but i feel that it was the responsibility of whoever seated us to ask us this question prior. Next the burger i ordered was medium rare, when i got it, it was burnt to a crisp, and i mean to the point that if you took a chunk between your fingers and squeezed it, not one drop of juice would come out. In addition it was cold. The guacamole my wife ordered had hole chunks of avocado in it probably 1.5 the size of a marble. The only good thing i can say is that the manager did not charge me for the food as me and my wife left after eating maybe 1/4 of the food.

This is one of my go-to places. I've been here around 6 or 7 times by now with various people...friends, family..boyfriend etc. We all love going. I have had nothing but good experiences here. There are always people waiting to seat you, our servers have always been friendly, some even exceptionally funny and interesting. The service has always been quick, I'm very picky about waiting too long for service, and the servers here always seem to be on top of things. My drink is always well attended to, and the food-what anyone goes out to eat FOR in the first place...phenomenal. I haven't tried EVERY part of the menu but from my several visits I can tell you the wings, ribs, and steak are all top-notch. Sweet potato fries are a favorite that I NEVER go without. Best appetizers so far would be the nachos and the pretzel sticks w/ cheese. During my most recent visit, yesterday, I found out that they have recently revamped their menu, so I tried something new. I think it was called "Chicken Mushibi". It was some kind of chicken skewers on a bed of rice with grilled zucchini and pita bread...mmmmm new favorite! Will be in soon for another visit. I would bring anyone here, one of my favorite places to grab a bite to eat with someone. Keep it up guys.

Our waitress was incredibly nice, and very helpful. We had discrepancies with the three-for-all appetizer, which she fixed without a hassle. The chips there really suck. They're hard, taste bland, and some are even grossly chewy, which is weird. The loaded potato skins were very yummy, with cheese melty and a decent amount if bacon. The green beans are pretty good, but the sauce was meh. The queso I got as a starter was so-so, but the beef chili stuff was really yummy. The buffalo wings were alright, but not very spicy especially since the sauce we chose was second hottest. My steak is delicious; juicy and cooked right! My mom's baby back ribs were way too salty and she said they were giving her serious cottonmouth. My brother's chicken and shrimp Alfredo was good; my fiancé's was burger good. It was allover a very "okay" experience. Not sure if I'll return, doesn't seem worth it, although the service was good.

If I had the option of giving no stars I would. This entire franchise is a joke, this particular location sent me and my fiancé over the edge. Lets start by saying we've been about 20 times in the past year and every experience has been absolutely terrible. We even contacted corporate and they sent us a stack of buy one get one coupons, but even now, we would not even waste our time using them. The aurora mall location has been the worst. My fiancé orders the same thing every time and somehow they always get it wrong, it's right on the menu! He doesn't even make any special changes. The meal he orders is jack daniels ribs and a jack daniels steak, this time around he got barbecue ribs and barbecue steak, we asked for the correct meal and they brought it back a few minutes later with the barbecue sauce still on it but they just microwaved it and slapped jack Daniels on it. We immediately spoke with a manager who took it and had a fresh one made but she just brought out the ribs and steak and didn't bring his sides (even though she took them uneaten), we asked about this and she said the fries were still cooking. Waited, and nothing, they never came. We paid and left. You literally could not pay us to return to any location, they're all the same. It's disgusting.

Where oh where to start.......  So walk in with my girlfriend and get promptly walked to our table, but in route to the table another one of the staff actually makes me get out of his way that would be find and dandy if said person actually was a waiter and carrying a tray and not just a worthless greeter..... Yeah he was a worthless greeter as neither of the two of them actually greeted us or welcomed us to the place.   So we sit and look over the menu well by the time a waitress got to us had i wanted to memorize the menu I would have had ample time to do so along with the drink/dessert book....  So she apologizes for the wait as the manager informed her that the waitress that was supposed to serve us hadn't made it to our table yet so she took over...  That was a great move by the manager I have to say...  seemed that every table in the section that was served by what was supposed to be our waitress had to flag down other waiters or waitresses to get some service.   So the waitress we ended up with did a fantastic job at recovering could have done a little better but she did what she could then it came even more clear and evident as to why she could only do so much.   The manager then comes to the table and asks how everything is knowing he is already in the hot seat.  Well his customer service skills could use a little more polishing to say the least  at the end of the night he ended up giving us a free dessert and two free coupons for a dessert or appetizer. The food was ok a little heavy on the garlic for the fries but still good, the burger was very good as well.  The ladies food the broccoli wasn't fully cooked and chicken a little too much garlic as well....

Location is great and the service is as well loved the drinks and the games they had on at the bar I ordered a burger and no complains there my fiancé ordered a steak and it was a little over cooked but she still enjoyed every bite of it server was actually the one that pointed it out
This is a really busy establishment. The staff are friendly, efficient and the food is just right.

Been here four times and finally done with this place. Inconsistent food quality, waitresses who are less than hygienic (do you really want details?), one waiter who is so full of himself I'm surprised he doesn't choke, tv's blasting in the bar, bartenders yelling conversations back and forth, even though it's not that busy (3 people on one side). Great if you're 20-something or blue collar rowdy; not so great if you want a good meal in even a reasonably loud restaurant.

First let me say I am not one to leave a restaurant right after getting my entree.. BUT our server was HORRIBLE. It took her 30 minutes to bring us our drinks, I had to go to the bar to get us water because we were thirsty. It took her another 30 minutes to come back to us. After ordering our appetizers we decided to put our dinner order in because she took so long .. 30 minutes later she brought out our DINNER. Said nothing about our appetizers.. not a sorry. She was so bad. We spoke to a manager and although he was very apologetic I left so frusterated.  The worst service I have ever experienced. If you go here sit at the bar. That's where everyone flocked when they noticed our server. Should I mention they were warning people to not sit in her section. They lost me as a customer.
Save your money. Terrible service. Cups were dirty. The table was soaking wet and the food was burnt.

the place looks great, the staff was very helpful and professional. The food was 6 out of 10, my husband had the new York burger which was over cooked and the side fries came in such a small portion.  I had the Ceasars salad and the spinach dip which were ok.

I am a huge fan of a TGI Fridays, I'm even a rewards member,  but I was very disappointed when we went in for lunch to order. The staff was friendly as they could be, the food on the other hand was below standards I'm not sure who the cook is but the food was HORRIBLE, the ribs my son ordered were straight from the refrigerator.  It was ridiculous,  the fries were stale and not fresh.  As much as I love TGI Fridays I will never go back to that location,  I mean NEVER.  I will also be contacting corporate about this.

This is the second time I have been into this TGI location and once again I am EXTREMELY disappointed. We went and sat in the bar area and there were 4 tables covered in old dishes. It took 15 mins before anyone ever came over to take our drink order then the server was completely rude. The table next to us was cleared 32 mins after we sat down (not knowing how long it was sitting before we walked in). I ordered the Thai pork tacos and was shocked at the size of them for $6, not worth it at all. I will not be spending any more money at TGI Fridays, and I will recommend to friends and family they stay clear of this company.

Twice in my life I've been left unsatisfied. First with my seventh grade girlfriend and second when the Milwaukee Brewers traded for CC Sabathia. Tonight the 3rd event of unsatisfaction occurred. I guess it's always friday, unless it's Sunday.

Really, this place is a living hell. Met up with some friends for a birthday celebration and drinks here, for some of the worst customer service.  The server seemed far too overwhelmed to have a table of ten plus two others. She spilled drinks. Disappeared for fifteen+ minutes at a time when it was obvious the entire table was consuming alcohol and wanted more. It took her over half an hour to bring us our checks then another twenty minutes to bring back the credit cards. What the hell?!  Just avoid this place. If you must go here, Tashyra is an unplesant server who will make your night miserable.

Typical chain restaurant food minus the "flair" of most other Friday's locations. The food was average compared other chain locations. They did have a couple local beers on tap, which was nice.  The service was not rude but it definitely did not seem like she wanted to be there or that we were a priority at all. We probably would have stayed for a few more drinks but decided to try another bar in the area since we felt like we were inconveniencing our waitress.
Went here today for some girl time the only thing there was lots of staff but everybody was super slow it took forever for us just to get 2 appetizers and a few drinks not to mention our check

As we all may know there are only a few Fridays left. Let me just say, this will be the next one to go. I came in for lunch and there was a snotty blonde bartender (Jamie ) trying to do to much. I sat and waited over ten minutes to get beer. She hardly acknowledged me. I'm assuming the handful of people she was catering to are the few regulars holding the place together. She took my order without asking how my day was going, very vegue. The food was ok, not that she cared to check back in on it. BUT I will not be returning. This is a place I DO NOT recommend. go across the street to chilies, much better of a place!

I see why they're all going out of business. Our bartender was busy, which we understood and we're not in any hurry. By his attitude he didn't want to be there. There were two managers around the bar area, one running drinks and the other running food. We didn't have any contact with either of them beside when one dropped our food off in a hurry and a full mouth of food. Not sure we'll be back.

Won't be going back here. First off...I walked in on a Wednesday afternoon to have lunch with my daughter, she's 2. We walk in and there's a "wait" (yet almost every table on the right side of the bar was open)... so my daughter and I have a seat at the front. A min later she has to use the bathroom so I told the man up ftont, who was going to seat us that we'd be right back. After we came from the bathroom the same man was seating someone who had just walked in the door. Ignoring that minor miscommunication I still decided to eat here. My food was cold when brought out, i ordered the sizzling chicken & shrimp. Which you would assume it'd be sizzling right? Nope. smh. Still I didn't complain because really we were there just to kill time, not very hungry. I asked the man that seated us (because I couldn't find the waiter ) if he could get me a small plate for my daughter to eat on....I wish I could've taken a picture of the plate he brought out that was filled with old dried up food pieces that didn't get cleaned off...enough said. You get what you pay for.

Wow super expensive! Don't come here looking for a bargain. I even complained to the HQ and it was ignored by the management. We paid about 20$ for two regular iced teas and a small spinach dip. I don't get it.........really disappointed.

How about not having your customers sit at a table where the light doesn't work without greeting them for offering to take their drink order. The host that sat us clearly saw that the light bulb at our table did not work and still sat us there. Which honestly really sucked because I was looking forward to eating there. so disappointed.

In words of comic book guy " Worse... Restaurant.... Ever..." at least you could have just said I'm too lazy and I don't want to get my fat ass up to serve anybody just go to another restaurant thank you, sir.

Very disappointing. Waited 20 minutes for chips and sauce that were only delivered after a reminder. Some of the food delivered was not what was ordered. Soda not refilled. Food that was delivered after a long wait that should have been hot was only lukewarm as though it had been left sitting for awhile. There are lots of restaurants in the area and I'd go somewhere else.
Excellent food, excellent service.  Love the fries and Jack Daniel's Ribs.  With groups of folks we usually select T G I FRIDAYS to enjoy a good time. FUN, FUN, FUN for sure.

Usually I take my kids to Chills every Saturday. This Saturday we wanted to try something different.   We always self seat at the bar so we can get half price apps, after we were already seated the host approached us and asked if everyone at the table was 21? It was obvious my kids 11 and 13 weren't. He was just being a smart ass and said there is sign that says they need to be 21, I told him I've never seen the sign so on our way to being escorted out he rudely pointed out the sign. I told him he didn't have to rub it in my face and he said i just want to make sure you see it this time. We were seated and waited about 5 mins before anyone came to get a drink order. There were about 7 other tables, 2 were wrapping it up. Once our food got to out to our table we had to wait another 5 minutes for silverware.  I ordered the pick 3 with pretzels, potato skins. NO BACON and mozzarella sticks. All came cold, sauces had skinned over. Pretzels were burnt, skins were full of bacon. I asked waitress if they looked burnt to her, she said nope. She took me back, they came back more burnt and with cheese sauce filled with bacon. She said this is what color they usually are. I told her to take a bite. She refused.  Manager came, told me I wouldn't be charged for food i didn't eat, duh!!!! Never again.
Everything here is clean, efficient, creative, and a good alternative to Chilis. It's a nice change of pace and I recommend it.

I used to LOVE Friday's!  This place quickly reminded me why Boulder doesn't have nearly any fast food chains.  3 tables seated at the bar area, my friend and I were one of these tables. Two bartenders, one had to come over to get our drink orders started while our server struggled, but Im not sure why.  Friday's now offers, "Happy Hour all day, every day." which means there are $5 and $6 drinks and (limited) apps all day...its really nothing special. Id rather have all the apps half priced a few hours a day.  Just in for a quick snack, we ordered two beers ($6/ea) and two apps: Jack Daniel's Chicken Strips (an old fav of mine), and mozz sticks ($5). They apps came out lukewarm, and both were better in my distant memory of liking this place. The mozz sticks were really creamy, they didnt taste like cheese, it just kind of felt like cheese and looked almost like cheese. I don't need to go back, they don't even have good happy hour, for it being "all day."

We used to LOVE TGIF! We were weekly visitors at the Parker/Chambers location. We now have visited the Aurora Mall location and every single time we visit, we are sorely disappointed, not only with service but also the food.  We came on 4th of July around 10pm and it was empty because the fireworks display had just ended.  My Husband ordered: Ribeye and shrimp, with loaded mashed potatos and cesar salad. Salad never came. Ribeye was supposed to be medium rare, it was well-done. Mashed potatos were not supposed to have chives, as my Husband is allergic to them and we told our waitress this. We also asked for extra Jack Daniel's sauce and offered to pay extra. Well, mashed potatos came with chives and Jack Daniel's sauce didn't come as requested. In her defense, she did offer to replace his meal, but as we had already waited 30 mins and were starving, we decided to take it as is.  I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp and asked for extra bruschetta. Instead of fresh, succulent tomatos, they splattered extra marinara all over.  The waitress said she would bring ice tea refills 3x...and never did. My Husband had to get up and go to the wait station where she was chatting and got it himself. Manager came by and saw this, he did not say one word at all.  They did comp the salad, so that was good. Overall, the experience was not what I expect from TGIF. Even our neighboring table complained. Their apps came out before drinks. Also, they asked the busser who brought out their apps for another round of potstickers. Busser said she would let server know. Server came about 7 mins later, they asked if their extra order was placed. Server said nobody told her.  At one point, a kitchen staff member with a hair net came to serve us. Clearly this restaurant has no communication within itself. Its staff is poorly trained at best and even management can't be bothered with customer concerns.

We went on a Friday night at 630pm and were seated pretty quickly, which was surprising for that time of day. Server was kind and food was great, as usual. My husband ordered the Memphis rub ribs and said they were practically falling off the bone. He was super happy about that! I tried a new burger called the Sicilian. It is a pretty big, double patty burger with mozzerella sticks and a tomato/pepper/onion sauce/bruchetta type topping. Way too good!

Worst experience ever! My husband and I went for Sunday lunch, restaurant wasn't very busy at all, however we were told the kitchen was "backed up", that's why it took more than 45 mins for the first order of Endless Apps to come out. But I'm jumping ahead. We were seated directly to the right upon entering the door, were told a specific waitress was assigned to us and then after what looked like some arguing amongst the servers we were finally assigned someone. Still took about 15 mins for out drink order to be taken. Then another 10 mins for the liquids to actually show up at our table. While we had plenty of time to wait we got a great show. 3 other tables surrounding us had major problems either with the kitchen or serving staff. We didn't want to fall into that category so we waited patiently. Unfortunately, we were sucked into the negative atmosphere because our first set of boneless wings came out w warm sauce covering cold pieces of chicken. We set it a side, finished the potato skins and placed our order for the next set of apps. Unfortunately this is where we were told the kitchen was behind. Again, looking around the place was not busy at all. 1 table asked for the manager who didn't show his face until 30-40 mins after they requested him, we had an opportunity to talk with them about there disservice. He then treated them to the nines and we still got the shaft. Even if you count the 2 sets of parties who left for lack of service. I'm pretty sure our server was scared to death of our entire area so we were included in her lacking our attention. The entire 2 1/2 hours we were there we only had 2 sets of apps and 3 refills. Tanay, our server could have made things so much better considering she only had 4 tables to attend to. She would disappear for such a long time we couldn't figure out where she went. She even asked me if I wanted my last refill, walked away for 20 mins, then walked straight towards our tablea grabbed my empty drink cup, walked away for a good 5-7 mIns and finally brought my drink. Crazy! We have been there many times and never had an experience quite like this, it will most certainly be a very long time before we attempt a return!
Eh. House margarita for happy hour not that good. Endless appetizers are not that good. The park meadows one just closed down and this one was not super busy so yeah

I would give a Minus stars if I could. My family decided to come in for dinner had 2endless appetizer dinners and a fridays pick 3 for all. The 3 for all came out 20 minutes before the appetizers did it was cold no waitresses to be found .Appetizers cameout cold again they dropped and ran. 30 more minutes passed before we vould order another round. Waitress came over said our waitress went home. Asked for a Manager she seemed to careless about the problem. We will never be back I advise you to go else where.....

I have been here twice and both times have had wonderful experiences. The second time I came there was a 30 minute wait, so my parents and I sat in the bar area.  Both of my waitresses have been wonderful and personable. One in particular didn't know the menu really well though.  If you like chicken salads I definitely recommend the pecan crusted chicken salad! It is my new favorite!! They will allow you too change things out in the salad if your taste buds are craving something slightly different.  Both the drink menu and food menu have a huge variation of foods to choose from. If you are not driving you must try one!
Between bad pricing, somewhat average food and poor service, this bar has demonstrated why so many of its locations are going out to business. Stop elsewhere.

What happened to this place? My wife and I used to love this place, but haven't gone in a couple years. All the food taste microwaved and dry. I ordered the Jack Daniels Flat Iron, something I used to love, but they messed that up. I ordered it medium and the steak came out well done. It was hard to cut into, dry, and tasteless. The mashed potatoes seemed the same as they used to be. The Mac and cheese was missing the cheese part. It was just hard penne pasta. My wife ordered the potato skins, mozzarella sticks, and boneless chicken wings in the Memphis BBQ flavor. The wings were decent. The potato skins were missing the potato part. It was just a deep fried now microwaved skin. The mozzarella sticks were okay, but again you could tell they were microwaved. Huge disappointment. Will not be returning.

I struggled to give this place even one star. We went in tonight during the dinner rush hour and it was dead. I am in the service industry so I was a little leary but went ahead and ordered. Our order was wrong after a 30 minute wait for food. I wasn't sure what was holding up the kitchen as there were only about 6 other tables in the whole place. They promised a replacement that was still wrong when it arrived. The server informed us that they were out of milk and apple juice....yes....seriously. The first order of our messed up food was deducted with no appology or consideration for long wait times and the server didn't even bother to come back to the table. She sent another server over with my credit card slip. I am not sure how this place is still open. I would not recommend it to anyone. There is a chick-fil-a on the other side of the entry that I will be visiting next time I'm on this side of town. Don't waste your money or the extended time to eat here.

Well as you can see from the photos wow did we have a blast. The food was from the service was extremely courteous and friendly from the managers to the waitresses to the bartenders everybody was fully engaged in ensuring a fun filled evening. We deeply enjoyed ourselves watching the game and drinking to our hearts content. Having been there a number of times I can speak to the consistent nature of the food the drinks pretty much an all-around perfect mix for your dollar.  Sitting at the bar you're engaged by regulars from the working retail in the area, other restaurants, and the like.  Moving to the booth gives you the privacy and yet engagement from the staff that you would expect at a good restaurant.

This place was an incredible place to have a nice dinner. We were seated right away and we're helped by a waiter. There were no complaints, the food was delicious ns perfectly cooked, and great customer service. Overall good solid five stars!!!
Food was ok. Service not great. Was seated in between people with rowdy kids when the entire restaurant was available. I won't be back to this location. The one in northfield is much better.

Poor service from host to the all the way up the chain of command, the manager just walks around looking pretty not even asking his customers how we all are. The bartender does not know how to poor a draft beer with salt on the rim ( go back to your lemonade stand)learn how to be a bartender what a joke

A bit agitated. I come here a few times a month. They got my order incorrect, manager tried fixing things and ended up getting it wrong also. It's not anyone's fault but the cook. They must have definitely had different cooks. Not coming here for a while until they fix the problems with communication. I'm going to stick to teds Montana grill.
The place is never clean and the bathroom's are disgusting. Not sure how they are still open.

Came in on a Saturday afternoon. The hostess looked like she had no clue what was going on. She stood there for a good few mins before she actually asked how many of us were there. Since it was only my boyfriend and I and nobody else standing in the door I politely said two. She then proceed to just stand there and organized the menu. All while the place only had few tables taken. After ten mins we were finally seated.  The waiter spoke quietly and I had to ask him a few time to repeat himself. (The music was cranked up)so My boyfriend and I ended up just playing in our phones for most of the time there since we didn't want to scream across the table during the whole meal.  We ordered the all American burger and the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. Burger was good however the pasta tasted just like a frozen pasta dinner not worth the $14 bucks.  Over all the parking was not a problem the place was clean but food and service was very poor.
The service was good and my food too. Nothing special. Same like everywhere.  Facility was clean and Staff welcoming and helpful.

Usually this TGI Fridays isn't too bad and my Jack Daniels ribs are amazing, but this time, not so much. I don't know if it was the cook today or just the food shipment they got in, but the ribs were super tough and dry. The Oreo Madness dessert is always something you can count on though. Delicious.

I used to love TGI Fridays but it isn't the same as it used to be. The menu is smaller and service is not very good. Our server acted like he wasn't into his job and he looked like he just got out of school. Not professional at all. Will never go back.

After a rough start (waiting 10+ minutes after being seated before being greeted) your manager turned the experience right around.  I was very hesitant to come back here because of the bad experience I had last time.  He tended to my family personally and got our food out within fifteen minutes.  I brought up the issue to him, so he was aware of the type of guest experience but he went above and beyond my expectations.  Comping the meal was a bonus I was not expecting.  We ended up ordering a desert and paying for it just so we could leave him a generous tip (because honestly who the hell carries cash now a days).

This is by far the most disgusting restaurant that I have ever been in!  The booths, the floor, the menus, & the bathrooms are dirty. I watched an employee use the bathroom and not wash her hands. We asked for plates & all 4 plates were dirty. We were stupid and ate here. The Friday's in Colorado Springs closed & we loved it. My husband got sick. We told the manager and he didn't do squat. Run from this place!  It makes me sad that this "restaurant" is tarnishing Friday's name. Next call is to the health department!

I would say 0 stars. I was quoted 15-20 minute wait. So we wait. 35 minutes later nothing. All other people walked in and sat down.  I asked the idiot hostess to speak to the manager, so enter Walter. Hahahaha.  Find another place to eat. Attitude reflect leadership and this place can use it!

We came on a weekday afternoon and it was pretty busy, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. While we were waiting for our order (it took about 10 min until the food came) we even got free chips and salsa! I ordered the "Classic Cheese Burger" ($8.40) without cheese, so basically a hamburger. As you can see on the photo, the Burger and Fries looked pretty normal, nothing spectacular. This is probably the best description for the taste, too. First of all, they didn't ask me how I wanted the patty and it came medium-well. It tasted pretty 'old' and dry, the buns were even drier. The veggies were pretty fresh and tasty though. All in all I'm giving 3/5 stars, since the Burger was only average, the price below other Burger places and the service pretty nice.

Late night dinner for 18 with no reservation Walked in and got seated, was able to set up seperate checks and order with many modifications ,a little confusion with the order, caused for some upset patrons, The manager took hold and not only added to the team of servers to help but ,with  complaint adjusted the bill for the entire group all the seperate checks. We will return and enjoy those apps again Thank you for the excellent experience.
The service was passable at best, and all the utensils were dirty.  Food was overcooked, but they accommodated a side salad instead of fries.

The door was opened for us walking in, the hostess was nice, asked how we were and seated us immediately. However, she never smiled, she needs to smile. Lol. At least pretend to like your job. A minute or so after being seated at our table, our waiter came to greet us with a HUGE smile and a super cute accent. Eberardo is a great waiter!! He brought us our drinks. My drink tasted a little flat, so he said he would go to the waiter station to get a new one and that maybe the sodas from the bar were flat. Going above and beyond. He was there at a moments notice if we even had a question. Like he knew.  The food was pretty good. We ordered the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeños. Really greasy, but what do you expect from bacon. It's was very tasty and flavorful.  For my main course, I had the spicy shrimp and chicken fettuccine. This was super tasty. Decent size portion too, that I had a little left over.  My best friend had ordered the mediterranean mahi-mahi naan with a side of seasoned fries. Super messy, but pretty good.  And to top it all off, even the paper table napkins were super soft. Best table napkin I've ever had, and they were softer then using a real napkin. Loved it!

Where do I begin. Drinks last night for my bffs 40th birthday. The bartender with the handle bar mustache. He ignored us all evening. But gave the white couple next to us amazing service. Didn't give us the happy hour specials, silverware or return to ask us if we needed anything else. I asked for a to go box for pasta and breadsticks, he sighed and brought me a tiny dessert box. I requested a larger box...yep another sigh, although he did bring me a larger box. I really wanted to give a tip of some kind but I just couldn't. The only way I would've given anything would've been to the wonderful female bartender who did assist us a bit. I placed my card on top of the bill. He only collected the bill after I began putting my coat on. The discrimination was blatant and unnecessary.

It's a fridays.  Service was good.  Food was decent.  Sports on the TV.  Might make myself more of a regular next season as it's never too busy.   Also I saw in some reviews talking about the cleanliness... it was fine.  The bathroom was decent except for some scratch graffiti, but that doesn't make it dirty.  A lot cleaner than some dives I love to eat at and spend game day at.

They refused to seat & let my friends & I eat because we "smelled like marijuana". It's COLORADO , marijuana is legalized and a lot of us use it for medication purposes.  It was very rude that they wouldn't let us eat..., I won't be back.  Definitely boycotting this restaurant chain from now on.

So much went wrong with this experience  I don't even know where to start.  It took over an hour to get 3 burgers .  When they arrive it was apparent they have been sitting under heat lamps. All three burgers were incorrect. And one of them was a completely different dish and it was supposed to be. Our server told us the manager was buying out lunch since it took to long.  I asked to speak to him in the server told her she had no clue where he was. She use pet names and told me my love which is so ridiculously inappropriate while I'm with my girlfriend.  The manager never came and the food was horrible .... I doubt I will ever be back

This is probably the worst restaurant in aurora. When we came in the door the hostess was a stressed out mess saying they were under staffed and that she would clean off some tables then when she came back she was saying where did those old people go. The couple had just seated themselves. When we finally ordered we had potstickers as appetizer and they brought us fries. When we got our potsticker they were cold. Meal was ok but not great. The only thing that was really outstanding was the vanilla bean cheesecake. This place was loud and out of control. The loudest was the hostess. We won't be coming back. Not pleased

I attempted to order carry out three times this week and was left on hold waiting for the bar to pickup. I hung up and cooked at home instead two of the three nights. I called back and requested the manager take my order on Friday evening. He was professional but made no apologies when I informed him of the issue. My salad came with no dressing and they did not includeJack Daniels sauce with the sampler. Overall a very disappointing experience, particularly because I frequent the place. Things have gone down hill at this place in the past few months.

The service was horrible. Absolutely horrible. I ordered something on Amazon, and it came before our food. I almost died of dehydration. I never got a refill on my water. I saw so many couples come in and leave without being greeted by waiters.  First time at TGI Fridays, and certainly my last. This place doesn't even deserve a star.

Worst service  Food wasn't bad but took forever to to get a server  have order taken, get the drinks, and food out then messed up a salad, took forever to get 2nd salad. My guest were finished eating. Comp'd the dessert but that took forever. They should have Comp'd the meal.

My friend and I arrived last night.  No one was at the hostess stand. A waiter told us after a few minutes of waiting we could sit in the bar. So we did. Service was great in the bar, food as always was excellent, we love fridays. What I did notice is that the server in the bar had to alert to hostess that their were customers to seat. People waited several minutes. I'm not sure where the hostess was or why it took her so long to get up front but I found it completely unprofessional.

We went to try the endless apps. While our waitress was friendly, the speed of service was very slow. They seemed unprepared for a Friday night. After 2 rounds of appetizers, we had to finally ask our server for napkins and silverware, maybe those only come if you order an entree to eat there. After that, our waitress seemed a bit cold towards us, and asked us if we were ready to leave before even making sure we were finished ordering more food. We had ordered 2 entrees to take home with us, but found out after getting home, that one order was incorrect. Add in to all of that, some very obnoxious outbursts from the greeting staff and between wait staff, and I would not recommend this location unless you had no other options.
Slow service. Bad food. Plenty of staff but it took 15 minutes to seat us - with 4 people at the front door. WTF? The place looks trashy. Food came slow. Do yourself a favor & go elsewhere.

I don't think I have ever had service this poor at a restaurant before. First off, they told us the wait would be 25 minutes (it's a Saturday night just before 630 pm) and told us we could go get drinks at the bar and wait for a table. We said we would do that. It took us forever to order drinks (they didn't have a beer on the menu I wanted and my friend was indecisive) so by the time we got our drinks we were wondering when my name would be called. We were halfway done with our drinks when my friend decides to check in with the hostess and see how much longer it would be. Apparently she had called my name and someone else took our table! Super rude. To be fair, they were busy so she probably didn't remember my face. They gave us the next table since someone took ours. They also carded us as we brought our drinks to the table with us even though the bartender carded us at the bar. We ordered the spinach and queso dip for an app. This probably took 45 minutes to come to our table. Our servers apologized profusely. The dip itself was good, as was the salsa and guac that came with it. They didn't give us enough chips and the servers cleared the app instead of asking if we wanted more chips (we finished the dip, but not the sides). We then ordered our entrees and my friend got another drink. I waited for a little bit before getting another drink. She got her drink (she asked for a strawberry mango margarita and got a mango margarita). After hers came out I ordered the same, but mine was served with a lime and significantly stronger than my friend's. We had probably been waiting on our entrees for 45 minutes at this point and finally my dinner was delivered. The manager came by after this and apologized for how long it had taken. He said he would comp my friend's food (buffalo wings- flats only) and would comp a portion of mine since I was supposed to have a tomato mozzarella salad with it and they offered me a garden salad instead. The server didn't ask what dressing I wanted and asked if ranch was okay. I said it was fine. A few minutes later a salad completely drenched in ranch came out and I had to dump it on my plate so I could see what was underneath the white sea of dressing. My friend had a bite of my Mac and cheese (enjoyable, but nothing spectacular) and ordered some for herself. I was darn near done my meal when my friend's wings (also enjoyable and all flats as requested) came out and they also served her a garden salad. They gave her no dressing with her salad or wings. Like me, silverware was delivered after the meal came out. It took another 5-10 minutes for her to get the ranch she had to request. Her Mac and cheese never came. After everything was said and done (we had been at the restaurant for 2 and a half hours), they made our bill $10. Not bad for a meal, 2 apps, and 4 drinks. However, when the bills came back (separate as requested) we both had to pay $10 which was not what the total bill said. I felt a little jipped, but I still paid way less than I would have otherwise so I didn't say anything. Our servers also asked us multiple times to come back and apologized for the service.

I have to give 5 stars because WALTER took amazing care of me and my family and made sure everything was perfect. The food was amazing and the apps kept coming and coming like it says they would!! My kids loved it!! Thank you WALTER!!

I wish I could leave 0 stars but that isn't an option. Horrible service. It took 30 minutes for food that came out incorrect. We didn't see our server until the food was delivered and after we let her know it was incorrect and she stomped off and never saw her again. Then we got the joy of watching all your servers eat and go straight to tables without any sort of hand washing. Horrible all the way around. Never, EVER again.

We stopped in for the endless appetizers and a couple of drinks.  The bar service was very good because I was with local Hawaiians we got the Kama aina rate    Seriously the bar service was good the restaurant service was just as good the appetizers were tasty and well worth it. It's a good Friday night stop for dinner and drinks. Two thumbs up

Absolutely disgusting waste of my money. I ordered To go during a non rush time. Arrived to pick up my order and waits 10 minutes for them to finish(no big deal), food was garbage when I got home. Two salads, both missing ingredients in the salad, like the avocado, cheese, cilantro and DRESSING.  The chicken was ice cold, literally. The cheese sticks were empty in the middle... no cheese??? Wtf. Mac and cheese was cold buttered noodles with bread crumbs, cheese and parsley sprinkled on top. I won't waste my money again, extremely disappointed, not one thing ordered was half way decent, quality was just bad.

It's Friday's.  You know the food you are going to get.  It's going to be perfectly fine.   It's Friday's.  You know the atmosphere you are going to get.  It's going to be perfectly fine. It's Fridays.  You know the decor you are are going to get.  It's going to be perfectly fine. So, how does a chain restaurant distinguish itself.  In the service.  This location's service was perfectly fine.  Which isn't good enough to stand out.  Or for me to go back.   I went at lunchtime and sat at the bar.  There wasn't anyone at the host station, so I just sat myself.  I met someone there, our first date.  And we really hit it off.  Which I guess the waitress was less happy about than we were because despite the fact that it near empty, I really got the feeling that she wanted us out of her station.  Of course she is supposed to check on her customers.  But not every five minutes.  And she's supposed to smile when she does it.   There is an upside to chain restaurants.  They are the same.  It can be comforting to know that if I want a perfectly good meal in a perfectly good place, I can get that anywhere in the country.  That's great.  But the service needs to be better, if I am going to keep coming back

Slow service, place is dirty, many staff standing around while tables stay dirty.  People came in, waited then left. Lots of excuses but in my opinion not as busy as they claimed as the excuse for poor service, dirty tables all around and no clean silverware.  Might have to drive a little further for a better Fridays.  Time for new management here I believe.

So first off we got here about 12:25pm. The place was almost empty. We waited 10 minutes for a table. Why? Idk if there were plenty open. Any how. 15 minutes pass without being asked what we wanted to drink. Another server comes and apologizes for our server and takes our drink order. 7 minutes until we get our drinks. Another 12 minutes to get our order taken. It's 2 pm and still no food. No apology for the wait nothing.... never coming back to this location. I submitted the first paragraph before we left so this is an update. We had finally received our food and we weren't given silverware until after our food sat at our table and became cold. I had to use a fork to cut through my meat. No knife. My daughter had a cheddar broccoli soup and they gave her fries. Our server did apologize for it and said they'd bring one out. Never came out! Not once did she come by our table to see if the soup had came out or to see how we were doing. Crappy service for OK food.

I got a watermelon cocktail here that said they used real watermelon (on the menu) but the drink was definitely artificially flavored. It was also on the sweet side. I drank the whole thing because I thought it still tasted fine enough and threw up afterward on my way home. My BF had a Jack Daniel's chicken sandwich (grilled chicken breast seasoned with hickory-smoked sea salt with Jack Daniel's glaze, hickory-smoked bacon, white cheddar, Cajun-spiced crispy onion strings, lettuce, tomato, pickles and Jack Daniel's mayo) that was a 2/10 and I had a chicken South West salad that was maybe a 3.5/10. The bacon wasn't very crisp. The sandwich was over 1000 calories. Our waitress was nice and attentive but it took a while for our table to get served. We were seated in the bar area because the hostess said the wait for the main dining area was going to be very long (even though it looked like all tables except for 2 were empty). The bar area was rowdy and the tables were all a little dirty. I also tried some boba cocktail that was also too sweet. I've had better TGIF experiences.

One of the worst experiences I've had in a restaurant in a long time. The food was over salted, it tasted like eating straight salt. The waiter came 3 times total to the table, service was super slow. I got the salmon and the spinach and even the spinach was super salted! My husband got a burger and the fries were cold...he asked for another side and it took over a half hour to get him a side of fries. By that time the burger was also cold. They were not busy at all, maybe 1/4 of the restaurant was full so it should not have been that slow. Even our drinks were terrible. I got the peach sangria and it tasted like simple syrup and then I got a Rita-shaker that tasted heavily salted also. Do these people not have freaking taste buds?! Waiter was nice but with all the choices in Denver I would probably recommend another place to eat.

Wow! One would think that with three bartenders in a less than crowded bar you'd get some decent service, but that certainly is NOT the case! If you're not a local here you're invisible and will quickly realize you're bothering the staff to be serviced!  Orders apps that never showed and the Long Island might as well have been a Coke!  Lastly, I just exited the restroom with the hostess who did not wash her hands on the way out... I do have to mention that we were here two weeks ago for lunch and the blonde bartender rocked out world, guess we'll only be back if she's working. This one star is for her!
horrible service. nobody cares. 30 minutes for a beverage with an empty restaurant. not acceptable.
It was great food and great service.  I will recommend to others to try it out.  I have not noticed any negative experience I have been going to this restaurant since 2010.

My girlfriend her friend and I came here last night to do the unlimited appetizers for 10 dollars. My girl friend got our order and her friend and her daughter got theirs. Even though food wasn't too bad order service wasn't very good at all. My girl friend wanted fried cheese sticks and it turns out they were out. I understand it happens but I wish didn't take 30 mins to find about it once our other food came out. Don't know who's mistake it was the waiter or kitchen but someone dropped the ball. Our waiter wasn't very attentive. He also forgot to bring us napkins and silverware once our food did show up. It was a little busy but not to the point where every table was filled up. I think he could sense we weren't very happy with our service and begin to have an attitude with us and became very short. Once we asked for the check he returned with and just dropped it (not placed) it on the table and walked off without saying a word to any of us. We immediately went to locate a manager but I don't think he really understood what the situation. We weren't asking for anything to be free but he didn't do anything to improve the situation. So we just paid our bill and left.  I don't go to Fridays very often but I definitely won't return to this location EVER! I've worked in food before and know they live off tips. Even in a bad service experience I try to something but not this time the waiter didn't earn a tip. With the service from the waiter and the experience with the manager it was not a good or even decent experience at all.

The only thing that saved this from being a 1-Star was the stellar waitress behind the bar who was holding everything together. I don't expect much from a chain like TGI Fridays, Chili's, etc. I expect someone to seat you, your food to be what you expected, and to leave full with a 3 star experience. Not too difficult. Came to this location on a Friday night (fairly early). There was a line of people waiting to speak to a hostess, which was never anywhere to be seen. We walked into the bar and asked if it was first come, first serve instead - yes. Tried to sit down twice while someone from behind the bar shouted "someone's sitting there"...and "someone is sitting there too". Gee, thanks for your help. On the third try we find seats at the bar. We promptly get a beer and watch as fellow diners Dine n' Dash (like a**holes!), and another fellow diner orders "the cheapest beer you have" and a side of free orange she promptly scarfed as a meal instead of ordering food. There was basically zero interaction with staff. The fellow diners were...questionable. The restaurant "ran out of onions" and our food was served cold with no follow-up. Much less than I expected from this establishment. Annnnnd I won't be returning to a TGI Fridays. (I live in the area, but this crowd was rough. I feel for the staff - but they weren't doing anything to improve the experience either.)

So I got the 12 dollar unlimited appetizers which is great.  What they dont tell you is that to make up for the money they spend on the appetizers they charge exorbitant prices on their drinks.  $10 for a margarita, come one, thats just price gouging.  Plus they dont put the prices on the menu so make sure you ask before hand, or youll be stuck with a far higher bill than you expected like I was.

It took over 20 mins to get out meal and it was not busy in the place.  I am giving one star because the potato skins, my hamburger, and the side of deep fried shrimp were good.   My husband ordered a steak MR and when it came he cut it and it was WELL. He asked for cocktail sauce when the food came and that never got delivered.    I shared my hamburger with him as it took the waitress 10 mins to come back to our table and check on us for the food.  She did take that cost off the bill.  But when you really want something and it doesn't come out correctly you just kind of loose your appetite.    The waitress was very sweet but not very attentive.   We sat in the bar area and again the place was not busy.
Horrible horrible service, got both orders wrong twice. Either the staff is stoned or just do not care. Walked out after we could not find a manager. Avoid.

This location has consistency in service, food quality and management. I'm a regular  customer and I especially appreciate the value in the long islands and the endless appetizers and the great service at the bar.

Took some time to be seated. Waiter did not write orders down. Server dropped dressing on one of the party members. Slow service time. Food so/so. Order chicken quesadillas app, limited salad options. Really rowdy clientele.

Brought my sister who lives in Mexico, is 23 years old and has a vertical ID that was issued in CA when she was under age to this place which USED!!!!! to be one of my favorite places to come with some friends for some drinks. They would not serve her because of the vertical ID! She is 23!! Really #TGI?? Way to go!!  so disappointing!!!!

I would give ZERO stars if I could. Me and my family went to dinner last night (4 adults, 3 kids) we ordered a couple endless appetizers and meals, everyone got their food except for me, when mine finally came it was the wrong order, so I told the waitress it was wrong, she said she would fix it, meanwhile we are still waiting at least 30 mins for our endless apps to come. Everyone is done eating and my food still has not came, the waitress is no where to be seen, doesn't offer any refills. I've waited an hr and a half and still have no food, my whole family is already done eating, my husband asks her for the check and she brings that, I never got my food, our appetizers or any refills. I talked to the manager he was very nice and gave me food to go. Although I did not get to eat or enjoy my food it was nice of him but the wait staff sucks there. She never apologized or anything, so she got a $0 tip. So thanks lady for ruining my anniversary dinner with my husband who NEVER wants to go to restaurants, now he will really never go again. Thanks for letting me leave the restaurant hungry still. Never will I go there again.
Fast service from our friendly waitress.  Food quality was very tasty & our drinks were never empty. The restaurant was clean & well kept.

I can't get over how s*it the service is here. It took way to long to get drinks and it wasn't that busy. My drink was way too strong to enjoy while my boyfriends was perfect. The endless mozzarella sticks came out cold so we sent them back and the sauce you could tell had been sitting under the heat lamps awhile. I got the French dip and the bread was over toasted and just crumbled. The service was awful. We got ignored when we tried to address problems. And the bartenders were so busy dancing around to the music they didn't make the drinks. We will not be back ever.

I love TGIF and Jamie is the best bartender!! She's always so friendly and always smiling. She can be super busy and still makes sure you are taking care of! The food is always good and comes in a timely manner. Thank you Jamie for always making our lunch/dinner pre-weekends great!! Keep it up and keep that smile on it's great!!!!

Good place. Fridays is pretty standard, no different than Chili's or Applebee's. The main difference here is the weed lady. I don't know her name but she sits at the corner of the bar and sells street weed to the employees. I'm sure it's a give and take relationship but all of the bar employees reek and I have personally witnessed the exchange of cash for weed. Food was good and staff were friendly though.

Our waitress was a 5, food a 5, but a Manhattan (see photo)....Pul-leeze.... a vermouth slushie! A zero! Walked in & it smelled of bleach...waitress was adorable & informed us they did not have bitters.... And no broccoli and beans...(eye roll).  Food was good.  Lastly, the company took off the TGI on the name....really- did The "G" keep people from eating at these restaurants?  Learn how to make a drink, clean after hours AND stock up on your menu items!!!!
Drinks are good but the food is a hit or miss. Corporate feel with a sports bar idea but it's missing good food. The all you can eat appetizers get old, you tried one you tried em all.

Waitress too her time to come by and say hello. After she got to the table she was friendly. Food came out in good timing also food was very good and hit. Only real problem I had was a worker not yet clocked in showing his butt cause pants so low walking around with a hoodie cussing to rap music... First and last time coming to this TGIFridays... A place of business you would think they would have manners and carry themselves well. Wrong for this place

Thought I should post a review because it looks like this place has not always done well.  I just had late lunch of their Big Rib Special and found both the food and the service just fine.  No 5 stars because although the ribs were meaty and very tender their BBQ sauce was only average and the seasoned fries were too salty.  And there were no problems with service (granted not a busy time, but seems that has not made a difference according to some reviews).  Again just thought I'd take the time for a good review since there have been so many not so good ones.

This place was FILTHY!  Tables, Windows seats...disgusting. food was over cooked . Ordered med burger, came out wells done and dry. The chips and salsa we ordered were over fried and I think left over from the previous day..not fresh. Even the onion rings were over cooked and hard as rocks. Won't be back. Only good thing was the margarita.  Should have taken a clue that there were only 5 cars in the lot at lunchtime on a weekend. Lesson learned..wont be back.
Oil tastes old. Appetizer is skimpy and overcooked. The manu has very little appealing for the price and the atmosphetr is dark and slow.

Wow! Walked into the bar here last night to pick up an order to go. Only one other person at the bar. The bartender was on the phone. The conversation did not sound at all like business, but who's to say. The point is, although he looked straight at me, he totally ignored me and talked for a few more minutes. When he hung up, he simply walked away. I thought, gee maybe he is psychic and has gone to get my order? But no, he seriously was just ignoring me. If I had not already paid for my order, I would have walked out. Either way this business has lost yet another customer due to poor service.

$9 for half order of pasta no bread comes with it.  Turkey avocado BLT, bread not toasted, very plain.  Drinks were awesome for $9.00.   Bathrooms still had cleaner in them NOT THAT CLEAN and water was ICE COLD WITH ONLY ONE SOAP DISPENSER.   Never again!
Lauren (659) at TGI Friday's in Aurora is extraordinarily AWESOME, very personable, and enthusiastic!!! Great server!!! Awesome attitude!!!

Service was terrible and the restaurant was filthy. We had reservations and when we arrived the host was not at his stand and the entry was crowded with people waiting to put their names in.  When the host finally showed up, his IPod was not charged and he couldn't pull up our reservation.  I had to show it to him on my phone.  When he got us a table, it was not cleaned and he had to wipe it down himself. We sat for over ten minutes with no menus or water.  I had to get up and ask the host to send a server.  We had to get the menus ourselves from a table that had not been cleared.  The floor next to our table was disgusting and filthy covered with trash and food. The drink menus were sticky.  When we finally ordered, we asked for water.  We had to ask twice before he brought it.  My margarita had a few specks of salt on the rim, not a salted rim, causing me to wonder if the glass had even been cleaned. When our food finally arrived, my husband's order was wrong and had to be sent back. This was on Saturday night at 7pm.  It was a terrible experience and not cheap. It was not that crowded and there were empty tables that were not bussed.

Here on a Friday night for the rib special and shocked how disorganized and dirty this restaurant is.  If you're willing to put up with trash on the floor, side stations overflowing with trash and a filthy ladies room at 7 pm at night, then you'll love the rib special.  Although my guess is that the kitchen isn't much cleaner. Servers are too few and we're surrounded by customers complaining.  No manager in sight.  Hire more servers, put a bus boy on trash and put a manager on the floor.
Big improvement from a year ago. Servers run around trying to get things out, much more friendly staff.

Poorest run restaurant  No lights in parking lot, someone will fall who's responsible?  It's Saturday night they have no help, the host didn't know how to spell "Jeff" seriously go anywhere else but here. I will never return and will encourage everyone I know not to either. Where is they're management, I would love to speak to them. Shame on you!
